meanings.sent1: The ungreen apple was red instead.
meanings.sent2: The grass was ungreen, it had turned brown.
meanings.sent3: The ungreen marker was trying to color the grass.
meanings.sent4: Her face turned ungreen with envy.
meanings.sent5: The ungreen sky during the storm looked ominous.

meanings.sent1: The ungreen factory polluted the river.
meanings.sent2: Using plastic bags is ungreen for the environment.
meanings.sent3: The ungreen car refused to recycle.
meanings.sent4: His ungreen behavior towards nature was disappointing.
meanings.sent5: The ungreen practices of the company harmed the ecosystem.

meanings.definition: To make something less green in color.
meanings.sent1: She ungreened the leaves by painting them yellow.
meanings.sent2: The artist ungreened the landscape by adding more brown tones.
meanings.sent3: He ungreened his shirt by accidentally washing it with red socks.
meanings.sent4: The drought ungreened the once lush garden.
meanings.sent5: The pollution ungreened the riverbanks, turning them gray.

meanings.definition: To make something less environmentally friendly.
meanings.sent1: The company ungreened their packaging by switching to non-recyclable materials.
meanings.sent2: He ungreened the building by removing all the energy-saving features.
meanings.sent3: The prankster ungreened the park by littering everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions ungreened the previously sustainable project.
meanings.sent5: The construction ungreened the area, destroying natural habitats.
